metadata.dc:author: Laval, Enrique
metadata.dc:description: After the great epidemic of the exanthematic typhus of 1918-1919 in Chile, there was a gradual decrease in the number of cases , until it became endemic around 1926. Starting in 1932 and until 1939 a new epidemic outbreak occured that prompted researchers to its study supported by the new clinical and technological advances of this period. Subsequently, two important events occured: the erradication of the vector ( human louse) by means of effective insecticides and the discovery of an effective antibiotic treatment.
metadata.dc:title: Epidemia de tifus exantem√°tico en Chile (1932-1939).
[Exanthematic typhus epidemic in Chile (1932-1939)].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista chilena de infectologia : organo oficial de la Sociedad Chilena de Infectologia
